title: Pumpkin Brownie Chunk Ice Cream Recipe
full_text:
Pumpkin Brownie Chunk Ice Cream Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
5 mins
Active
60 mins
Churning/Freezing Time
14 hrs 30 mins
Total
14 hrs 40 mins
Serves
8
to 10 servings
Makes
1 quart
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
cup
pumpkin purée
, canned or
homemade
6
egg yolks
3/4
cup
raw (
turbinado) sugar
1
teaspoon
kosher salt
1/2
teaspoon
cinnamon
1/4
teaspoon
clove
2
cups
heavy cream
1
cup
whole milk
1
teaspoon
bourbon
2
cups
small
brownie
chunks, chilled in freezer (see notes)
Directions
In a medium saucepan, whisk together pumpkin purée, egg yolks, sugar, salt, and spices into a paste. Slowly whisk in cream and milk until smooth.
Set on medium-low heat and, whisking frequently, cook until custard thickly coats the back of a spoon but a swiped finger leaves a clean line. Stir in bourbon, strain into an airtight container, and chill overnight.
The next day, churn according to manufacturer's instructions. When finished, remove churning puddle and quickly stir in brownie chunks with a wide spatula. Transfer to freezer and chill for 2 to 3 hours or until firm.
Special Equipment
Ice cream maker
Notes
The brownie chunks need to stay soft even when frozen. To achieve that I don't think you can do better than Smitten Kitchen's
cocoa brownies
. They're dead simple to make and are dark enough to stay flavorful under deep chill. This recipe calls for about 2/3 of the batch, leaving you with some to snack on while the ice cream churns. Let the brownies cool completely before cutting into small (1/2-inch) chunks, and trim away the crisp edges.
